translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The forward and reverse order of conditions in relation to mental phenomena, the triplets and couplets in the Paṭṭhāna,

original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Tikadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (4)🔽16.48. Sanidassanattika, Hetusampayuttaduka🔽Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ hetusampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanidassanaappaṭigho nahetusampayutto🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ hetusampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca🔽nasanidassanasappaṭigho nahetusampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā …pe… anidassanaappaṭighaṁ🔽hetusampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasanidassanasappaṭigho nahetusampayutto ca naanidassanasappaṭigho
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  sani dassana ttika hetu sampayutta duka  anidassana appaṭigham hetu sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na anidassana appaṭighaḥ na hetu sampayuttaḥ  dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā anidassana appaṭigham hetu sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca  na sa nidassana sa ppaṭighaḥ na hetu sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā pe a nidassana appaṭigha  hetu sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ na hetu sampayuttaḥ ca na anidassana sa paṭighaḥ
translated: The visible-data-base, the cause-related, the couplet

original: nahetusampayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha, ārammaṇe🔽tīṇi …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: na hetu sampayuttaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha ārammaṇe 🔽tīṇi pe a vigate cha
translated: A visible-data-base, cause-related idea has a non-visible-data-base, cause-unrelated idea as its condition by way of conditionality condition. original: Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ hetuvippayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasanidassanasappaṭigho nahetuvippayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: anidassana appaṭigham hetu vippayuttam dhammam paṭicca na sa nidassana sappaṭighaḥ na hetu vippayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With non-evident, non-receiving as condition, a non-evident, non-receiving factor that is not related to a cause arises, by way of conditionality. (In brief.) With a cause as condition, there are three. … With an object as condition, there are three. … With non-deliberation as condition, there are three. … With non-contention as condition, there are three.
